Job Title: User Experience Designer

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
This position is onsite in our beautiful downtown Dallas office or Rochester NY (remote not available)About Us We are a highly diverse, collaborative, and entrepreneurial team of innovators, on a mission to transform the way ISPs serve consumers today. 2024 will be a pivotal year for our company, as we transform our service approach, lead the way in fiber technology innovations, and launch an enviable brand and customer experience.About YouYou are an energetic and innovative self-starter with strong skills in UX and visual design and real-world experience applying design and UX best practices to create exceptional experiences. You have a positive attitude and willingness to learn. You bring curiosity, empathy, and a collaborative approach to your work.About the Role You will play a key role in helping us transform our digital experiences. Through collaboration with cross-functional teams you will determine UX and business needs and deliver high-quality, thoughtful, beautiful solutions that solve real user pain points and meet or exceed key success metrics. You will also work closely with developers to ensure that concepts are translated into functional solutions for mobile and web and help to evolve our growing design system.
Responsibilities: Collaborate with product managers, developers, researchers.Present design work to working teams and senior leadership for review and feedback.Work with other designers to ensure that deliverables align with the design system and help to evolve or add components as needed.Assess and optimize the performance of new and existing features by actively participating in user research and leveraging performance metrics.Advocate for design solutions, by articulating factors that influenced the decisions made including business and user goals, demographic and usage data, and research findings.Qualifications: 5 years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer or similar roleBachelor’s degree in design, human-computer interaction, or similar. Masters’ degree in a related field a plus.Fluency in best practices for usability, information architecture, and designExperience working in a collaborative multi-disciplinary team and working directly with developers for implementation of designExperience with design, prototyping, and presentation tools such as FigmaExperience in an agile/scrum environment is a plusExperience building and maintaining design systems a plusA portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great user-centered design solutions requiredCreate high-level storyboards, mock-ups, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
